feature: Document the CSS design system and component architecture
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the CSS design system currently embedded in index.html (~520 lines). The documentation will cover design tokens (colors, typography, spacing), component styles, layout patterns, and responsive behavior.

subtasks.title: Document spacing and layout tokens
subtasks.description: Document the spacing scale, layout dimensions, border radii, and transition values
acceptance_criteria: Layout dimensions documented (content-width, sidebar-width, container-max, gap)
Transition values and when to use each
subtasks.notes: Comprehensive spacing and layout documentation completed. Documented all 9 spacing values (space-1 through space-header) with 4px base unit system, multipliers, and usage guidelines. Added layout dimensions (content-width: 580px, sidebar-width: 240px, container-max: 860px, gap: 40px) with visual ASCII diagram showing layout math (580 + 40 + 240 = 860). Documented border radii (radius-sm: 2px, radius-md: 3px) with design philosophy explaining minimal aesthetic. Added transition values (transition-fast: 0.15s, transition-normal: 0.2s) with timing rationale, easing choice explanation, and property-specific guidelines. Included responsive behavior documentation (space-header adjusts: 70px → 50px → 32px across breakpoints). Created comprehensive best practices sections with Do's and Don'ts for spacing, layout, border radii, and transitions. Added quick reference section for rapid lookup of all values. Followed existing documentation patterns from color palette and typography sections with tables, rationale, accessibility notes, and usage guidelines. All acceptance criteria met: 4px-based spacing scale documented, layout dimensions documented with rationale, border radius options documented, and transition values documented with usage guidelines. Commit: 4375bf0

subtasks.title: Document content components
subtasks.description: Document widget, profile-image, flight-stats, contact-section, social-links, share-section, signature, and subscriber-count components
subtasks.notes: Comprehensive content components documentation completed. Documented all 8 components: .widget (sidebar container with widget-title and widget p styles), .profile-image (full-width profile photos with 580px max-width and responsive 16px vertical margins on mobile), .flight-stats (infographic images with 20px vertical margin, no max-width), .contact-section (footer contact area with 32px top margin, 24px padding, and gray-200 border-top), .social-links (vertical flexbox link stack with 8px gap and gray-700 links), .share-section (bordered sharing area with 24px top margin and 20px top padding), .signature (author byline with font-style: normal and 20px top margin), and .subscriber-count (newsletter metrics with 12px font-size, gray-600 color, and 8px top margin). Each component documented with: CSS implementation with detailed inline comments showing token values, HTML structure examples demonstrating proper semantic markup, styling details explaining visual properties and design rationale, responsive behavior tables showing breakpoint adaptations, usage guidelines with comprehensive Do's and Don'ts, accessibility notes including WCAG contrast ratios and semantic HTML requirements, and composition patterns showing how components work together. Added comprehensive sections including: design rationale explaining content component philosophy (semantic structure, consistent spacing, visual hierarchy, responsive adaptation, composition patterns), component overview table comparing all 8 components by type/margin/border/use case, best practices with Do's and Don'ts for all content components, composition examples (sidebar with multiple widgets, article with images and share section, footer contact section), accessibility summary table showing semantic HTML/alt text/color contrast/spacing for each component, and quick reference guide with ASCII formatting for rapid lookup. Documented responsive behavior: profile-image and flight-stats change to 16px vertical margin at 768px, contact-section adjusts to 24px top margin and 20px/32px padding at 768px, social-links-inline changes gap to 24px and font-size to 14px at 768px. Followed established documentation patterns from interactive components section with detailed code examples, comparison tables, rationale sections, and quick reference guides. All acceptance criteria met: each content component purpose documented with design rationale, HTML structure examples provided for all 8 components showing proper semantic markup and usage contexts, styling variations explained (widget-title vs widget p, social-links vs social-links-inline, profile-image vs flight-stats), and component composition patterns demonstrated with comprehensive examples. phases.name: Responsive & Advanced Patterns
phases.description: Document responsive breakpoints, mobile adaptations, and advanced CSS patterns

subtasks.title: Document responsive breakpoints
subtasks.description: Document the three breakpoint system (768px, 480px, 360px) with what changes at each breakpoint
acceptance_criteria: Variable overrides at each breakpoint listed
Component adaptations at each breakpoint explained
subtasks.notes: Comprehensive responsive breakpoint documentation completed. Documented all three breakpoints (768px Tablet, 480px Mobile, 360px Small Mobile) with complete CSS code examples, comparison tables, and rationale. Documented all variable overrides (--text-4xl: 80px→48px→32px→28px, --text-base: 13px→14px on mobile, --space-header: 70px→50px→32px) and component adaptations (navigation wrapping, image margins, heading sizes, container padding changes). Clarified desktop-first approach using max-width queries with comprehensive pros/cons analysis compared to mobile-first. Added responsive design patterns section covering typography scaling, spacing condensation, layout simplification, and touch target optimization. Included best practices with Do's and Don'ts, accessibility considerations (font size minimums, touch targets, spacing, reading order), breakpoint quick reference tables for rapid lookup, and testing checklist. All acceptance criteria met: breakpoint values and rationale documented with device targeting explanation, variable overrides at each breakpoint listed with complete values, component adaptations at each breakpoint explained with code examples, and mobile-first vs desktop-first approach clarified with trade-offs analysis. Commit: c202721

subtasks.title: Document CSS reset and base styles
subtasks.description: Document the CSS reset approach and base body/html styles
subtasks.notes: Comprehensive CSS reset and base styles documentation completed. Documented universal reset (box-sizing: border-box, margin/padding removal) with detailed rationale explaining modern reset philosophy vs traditional aggressive resets. Documented HTML root element (font-size: 16px, -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased, -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale) with property breakdown and browser-specific considerations. Documented body element with complete typography stack (Helvetica Neue, 13px, 400 weight, 1.75 line-height, gray-700 color, white background) including inheritance behavior and accessibility notes (7.4:1 contrast ratio). Added comprehensive Browser Normalization section covering font smoothing for WebKit browsers and Firefox/macOS, visual comparison of antialiased vs subpixel rendering, cross-browser considerations explaining why additional normalization is not needed for modern browsers, browser support table (Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+, Edge 90+), accessibility notes about font smoothing impact on readability with mitigation strategies, and user preference media query suggestion. Included best practices sections with Do's and Don'ts, quick reference code blocks, and key takeaways table. Followed established documentation patterns from color palette and typography sections with detailed tables, rationale sections, accessibility considerations, and visual code examples. All acceptance criteria met: reset methodology explained with box-sizing/margin/padding details, font smoothing approach documented for WebKit and Firefox, base typography settings explained with inheritance and accessibility notes, and browser normalization notes with cross-browser considerations and testing recommendations.
